intro: Hieracium glaucinum, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its hairy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Hieracium glaucinum is often found in open habitats where it can receive ample sunlight.
